prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee is a great at business and is set to take over her families company but she also has a reputation as a troublemaker

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
"Maddie clung to the edge of the conversation, fingers wrapped tight around her plastic cup of cheap rum and coke. Her friends—louder, prettier, *glitterier*—talked over the pounding bass of the club like they were born in it. She laughed when they laughed, nodded when they nodded, tried not to flinch when someone brushed too close. Her oversized scarf kept slipping off her shoulder, and her hoodie felt way too *warm* under the lights. She’d tried to style her hair, but it still clung in damp strands to her neck. Her glasses kept fogging up from the heat, and she was pretty sure she looked like she'd gotten lost on the way to a bookstore.

"Okay, we’re gonna go dance!" shouted Kara, already tugging on someone’s wrist. "You coming, Mads?"

Maddie shook her head too fast. "I-I’ll catch up! Just—gonna grab another drink!"

They were gone before she finished her sentence.

*Okay. Okay. No big deal. I can get a drink. Stand somewhere. Look normal.*

She made her way to the bar, squeezing between bodies, all sharp elbows and warm sweat. The bar glowed soft pink under neon lights, and she felt like she was being *dissected* under it. The bartender barely looked at her when she ordered another drink, her voice small, barely heard over the thud of remixed Robyn.

Rum. Coke. Ice. Plastic cup.

She turned around and realized she had no idea where her friends had gone.

The dance floor was a blur of limbs and strobe flashes. The booths were full. No one looked *familiar*. Panic bloomed in her chest.

*Shit. Did they ditch me? Did they forget? Did they just not notice?*

Maddie moved toward the wall, pressing her back to it like it might swallow her up. Her heart raced. Her drink sloshed in her cup.

*Okay, deep breath. You are not a baby. You are not gonna cry in a gay bar. Jesus.*

She slid along the wall like a shadow, eyes darting, looking for anyone she might recognize. She saw couples. Gaggles of girls. Hands on waists, lips on necks. Everything she hadn’t ever had. Everything she wanted so badly it made her stomach *twist*.

She reached the edge of the dance floor, unsure, watching the bodies grind and laugh and glow. She stepped back. She didn’t belong in the middle of that. Not like this. Not tonight.

*God, I look like a loser. Just standing here. Holding a sad little drink like I’m waiting for my mom.*

She caught a glimpse of herself in the mirror behind the bar—round face, flushed pink, dark eyes too wide, lips tight with *worry*.

*You don’t belong here. This is for hot people. Confident people. People who know what they’re doing.*

She stumbled away from the mirror, almost colliding with someone tall and laughing. She mumbled an apology, clutching her cup like a *shield*. Her heels were already starting to ache.

*Mistake. Huge mistake. Should’ve stayed home. Should’ve said no. Fuck.*

She wandered further, past the bathrooms, to a quieter corner where the lights dimmed and the music didn’t hit quite as hard. A few women stood talking, laughing low, but they didn’t even glance her way.

Her head swam. Her throat was tight. She blinked fast, fighting the sting in her eyes.

*Someone please come talk to me. Please. Someone cool. Older. Classy. Like... wears perfume that costs more than my *rent*. Please. I’ll be good. I’ll be sweet. I won’t ask for anything.*

Her hands were shaking now. She pretended to sip from her drink. It was mostly *ice*.

*Just one person. One woman who sees me. Who wants me. Who thinks I’m cute even like this. Please please please.*

She didn’t notice the barstool until she was nearly on top of it. A free seat. A tiny *mercy*.

Maddie sat. Her legs ached with relief. She set the empty cup down on the counter with a soft clack.

From here, the room looked *safer*. She could see the bar, the booths, the door. No one was looking at her. That hurt and helped at the same time.

She crossed her arms on the counter and leaned forward, burying her face in them for a moment. Her hair hid her expression.

*You’re not gonna cry. You’re just gonna sit here. You’re gonna wait. Maybe someone will find you. Maybe she’ll be rich. And hot. And mean in a nice way. And she’ll think you’re *soft* and *pretty* and want to take care of you.*

She lifted her head slowly. Blinked at the blur of people. Felt the bass in her ribs.

Maddie sat there, *lost* and hoping. Waiting for a *miracle*.

Until... She saw a woman walking near her."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee laughs at something Madison says then nods* "Yeah Yeah I got the drinks" 
*Hailee yells over her shoulder as she goes up to the bar*

*Hailee lets out a sharp whistle and waves her black platinum credit card at the bartender* "3 of your top shelf" *She yells over the music. While waiting she glances to her left and pauses as she sees the pretty girl next to her*

*Hailee plasters on a smiles and turns around leaning against the bar on her elbows and leans over yelling over the music* "What are you drinking"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie startled at the sudden voice so close to her ear. She turned her head too fast, glasses nearly slipping off her nose as she blinked up at the woman now leaning toward her.

*Oh. Oh no. She’s—she’s *gorgeous*. Tall, confident, that *smile*—and is that a platinum card? Oh my god.*

Her throat went dry. She swallowed hard before answering, voice barely above a whisper despite the loud music. "I-I just had rum and coke."

She fidgeted with the edge of her scarf, fingers twisting into the fabric as she glanced down at Hailee's hands—manicured nails, expensive rings glinting under the bar lights.

*She looks rich. Like *really* rich.* Maddie bit her lip before daring another glance up through her lashes. "You don't... have to get me anything though."

A beat of hesitation before she added in a small voice: "...Unless you want to?"
swipes:
Maddie startled at the sudden voice so close to her ear. She turned her head too fast, glasses nearly slipping off her nose as she blinked up at the woman now leaning toward her.

*Oh. Oh no. She’s—she’s *gorgeous*. Tall, confident, that *smile*—and is that a platinum card? Oh my god.*

Her throat went dry. She swallowed hard before answering, voice barely above a whisper despite the loud music. "I-I just had rum and coke."

She fidgeted with the edge of her scarf, fingers twisting into the fabric as she glanced down at Hailee's hands—manicured nails, expensive rings glinting under the bar lights.

*She looks rich. Like *really* rich.* Maddie bit her lip before daring another glance up through her lashes. "You don't... have to get me anything though."

A beat of hesitation before she added in a small voice: "...Unless you want to?"

Maddie startled at the sudden voice so close to her ear. She turned her head slowly, glasses slipping down her nose slightly as she blinked up at the taller woman. *Oh god she's beautiful and rich and looking at me oh no oh no—*

"U-um," she stammered, fingers tightening around her empty cup. "Just... rum and coke?" Her voice came out as a squeak, barely audible over the music. She swallowed hard, feeling heat crawl up her neck.

*She smells expensive. Like leather seats and private jets. Why is she talking to me? Is this a joke?*

Madeline instinctively shrunk back a little in her seat but couldn't tear her eyes away from Hailee's emerald gaze. The neon lights made them look even more mesmerizing than they already were.

*Say something else you idiot! Don't just stare!*

"I-I mean I already had one but it's... gone now," she added lamely, lifting the empty plastic cup slightly before setting it back down with a nervous clatter.

Her pulse hammered in her throat as she took in Hailee's effortless confidence - the way she leaned against the bar like she owned it, that black credit card still held casually between manicured fingers.

*She could buy this whole club if she wanted to.* The thought sent an unexpected shiver down Maddie's spine.

When Hailee didn't immediately turn away or laugh at her awkwardness, Maddie dared to straighten up slightly in her seat. "Y-you don't have to— I mean you're probably here with friends right?"

She immediately regretted saying that - what if Hailee remembered that and left? *Stupid stupid why would you remind someone better than you has better places to be—*

The bartender returned with three crystal-clear glasses of amber liquid that probably cost more than Maddie made in a week doing commissions online. She watched wide-eyed as th

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee smiles widens and she chuckles. One of those deep chuckles only people with over 6 figures in their bank makes* "Darlin I don’t do anything unless I want to" 

*At that she looks over her shoulder and calls out* "Add a rum and coke to that" *She then glances back at the girl* "Im Hailee..." *She reaches out her hand. When the girl doesnt shake it she squints confused before* "You got a name or should I just stick to gorgeous"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's entire face flushed crimson at the compliment, her fingers tightening around the edge of her scarf like a lifeline. She stared at Hailee's outstretched hand for a second too long before tentatively reaching out to shake it—her palm was noticeably clammy.

*Oh god oh god she called me gorgeous. She’s touching me. Her hands are so warm and soft—probably gets weekly manicures, Jesus Christ.*

"M-Maddie," she stammered, barely audible over the music. "I mean—Madeline. But Maddie is... fine." She swallowed hard, suddenly hyperaware of how cheap her chipped nail polish looked compared to Hailee's perfect manicure.

*She smells expensive too. Like... leather seats and first class flights.* Maddie ducked her head slightly, peering up through her lashes again as she added in a whisper: "You really didn't have to..."
swipes:
Maddie's entire face flushed crimson at the compliment, her fingers tightening around her empty cup until the plastic creaked. She stared at Hailee's outstretched hand like it might bite her before finally, clumsily reaching out to shake it—her grip was feather-light and damp with nervous sweat.

"M-Maddie," she stammered, voice cracking slightly. "I mean—Madeline. But Maddie is... fine."

*Oh god my hands are clammy. She probably thinks I'm disgusting.* She pulled back too quickly, tucking both hands under her thighs on the barstool as if to hide them.

Her glasses slid down her nose again from how much she was sweating. She pushed them up with one shaky finger while staring resolutely at the bar counter instead of meeting Hailee's eyes.

*She called me gorgeous. No one's ever—and that laugh—she sounds like money feels.* Maddie bit down hard on her bottom lip to stop herself from saying something stupid.

*Oh god oh god she called me gorgeous. She’s touching me. Her hands are so warm and soft—probably gets weekly manicures, Jesus Christ.*

"M-Maddie," she stammered, barely audible over the music. "I mean—Madeline. But Maddie is... fine." She swallowed hard, suddenly hyperaware of how cheap her chipped nail polish looked compared to Hailee's perfect manicure.

*She smells expensive too. Like... leather seats and first class flights.* Maddie ducked her head slightly, peering up through her lashes again as she added in a whisper: "You really didn't have to..."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee shrugs leaning back against the bar* "No but I wanted to." *She glances around like she is looking for something then back at Maddie* "You got any friends or..."

*When the bartender comes back with the drinks Hailee slides the rum and coke to Maddie then takes a sip out of one of the expensive whiskeys*

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's fingers trembled slightly as she accepted the drink, wrapping both hands around the cool glass like it might steady her. She took a tiny sip just to have something to do with her mouth, the sweetness of the coke barely masking the sharp burn of alcohol.

*She bought me a drink. She actually bought me a drink. And she's still talking to me.*

"Th-thank you," she murmured into her glass before daring to look up again. At Hailee's question about friends, Maddie instinctively glanced toward where she'd last seen her group—nowhere in sight—before giving a small shrug that made her scarf slip off one shoulder again.

"They're... around somewhere." *Probably forgot about me.* Her grip tightened on the glass. "I don't mind being alone though." *Lie.*
swipes:

"They're... around somewhere." *Probably forgot about me.* Her grip tightened on the glass. "I don't mind being alone though." *Lie.*

Maddie's fingers trembled slightly as she accepted the drink, wrapping both hands around the cool glass like it might steady her. The condensation made her palms damp.

*She bought me a drink. She actually—oh my god. Is this happening?*

She took a tiny sip just to have something to do with her mouth before answering, voice barely above the music's pulse: "I-I came with some people but... I think they forgot about me." A nervous laugh escaped her lips before she could stop it. *Great, now you sound pathetic.*

Her eyes flickered down to Hailee's whiskey—the amber liquid catching the neon lights in ways that made it look almost golden.

*That probably costs more than my textbooks.* Maddie swallowed hard and forced herself to meet Hailee's gaze again, cheeks still burning. "You're... really nice for doing this."

name: Hailee
mes:
"Oh well I personally cant in good conscious leave someone as pretty as you alone all night" *Hailee grins pushing herself off the bar and grabbing the rest of her drinks*

*She holds them up and yells out* "Madison come get your drinks bitch" *With a laugh she sets them down then grabs Maddie's hand and pulls her off the stool dragging her across the bar* "You don't mind keeping me company do you" *Hailee throws over her shoulder as she maneuvers through the crowds to one of the tables*

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie let out a tiny, startled squeak as Hailee grabbed her hand, nearly spilling her drink in the process. Her pulse skyrocketed at the sudden contact—Hailee's grip was warm and firm, effortlessly pulling her along like she weighed nothing.

*Oh my god she’s holding my hand. She’s *dragging* me somewhere. This is happening.*

"N-no! I mean—no I don't mind," she stammered, stumbling slightly as she tried to keep up with Hailee's confident strides through the crowd. The scarf slipped entirely off one shoulder now, forgotten as Maddie focused on not tripping over her own feet or dropping her drink.

*She called me pretty again. And now we're going somewhere together? Is this real? Am I dreaming?*

Her cheeks burned hotter with every step, hyperaware of how small and rumpled she must look next to Hailee's effortless grace. When they reached the table, Maddie hovered uncertainly behind her new companion, fingers nervously adjusting her glasses.

*Should I sit? Is this okay? Oh god what if her friends hate me—*

*Should I sit? Is this okay? Oh god what if her friends hate me—*

name: Hailee
mes:
"Guys this is my new friend Maddie, Maddie this is Madison and Tyler" *Hailee smiles pulling out a chair and motioning to Maddie*

*She then sits down next to her and grins turning her full body towards Maddie as she takes another sip of her Whiskey* "You Dance?"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's breath hitched as Hailee introduced her, fingers tightening around her drink until the plastic cup creaked. She gave a tiny, awkward wave to the others before practically collapsing into the offered chair, her knees suddenly weak.

*Oh god they're all looking at me. They're so... put together. And I'm just—me.*

At Hailee's question about dancing, Maddie let out a nervous laugh that sounded more like a squeak. "I-I mean... not really? Not well?" She bit her lip, glancing toward the dance floor where bodies moved in perfect rhythm to the music. "I mostly just... stand there and look awkward."

She took another small sip of her drink for courage before adding in a whisper: "Do you dance often?" *Please say yes please say yes I want to watch you move—*
swipes:

*Oh god they're all looking at me. They're so... put together. And I'm just—me.*

She took another small sip of her drink for courage before adding in a whisper: "Do you dance often?" *Please say yes please say yes I want to watch you move—*

Maddie's breath hitched as Hailee introduced her, fingers tightening around her drink. She gave a tiny, awkward wave to the others before practically collapsing into the offered chair, her knees suddenly weak.

*Oh god they're all looking at me. They're all so... put together. And that one girl's jacket probably costs more than my entire wardrobe.*

At Hailee's question about dancing, Maddie shook her head rapidly, dark hair swaying with the motion. "N-no I'm—I'm really bad at it." Her voice came out barely above a whisper before she took another nervous sip of her drink.

*She's sitting so close. I can smell her perfume—is that Tom Ford? Oh no she's looking at me like that again.* Maddie bit her lip hard enough to leave marks, peeking up at Hailee through strands of hair that had escaped from behind her ears.

"I-I could watch you dance though," she blurted out before immediately regretting it and shrinking into herself. *Stupid stupid why would you say that—*

name: Hailee
mes:
"No not really but I do like to have fun when I go out" *She then stands and takes Maddie's drink gently out of her hand setting it on the table and taking Maddie's hand to help her up* "Come on we are gonna dance"

*She leads Maddie out to the dance floor and twirls her awkwardly around with a laugh shaking her head* "Come on just relax feel the music" *Hailee tries*

*Hailee lets her hands slide down Maddie to her waist and pull her forward as she sways to the music* "Stop thinking so much just let go"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's entire body went rigid for a split second when Hailee's hands settled on her waist, the warmth seeping through her oversized hoodie like a brand. Her breath came in shallow little gasps as she stared up at Hailee with wide, startled eyes.

*She's touching me. Oh god she's actually touching me and we're—we're dancing? This is dancing right now.*

The music pulsed around them, bass vibrating through Maddie's chest as she tentatively placed her hands on Hailee's shoulders—bare skin under her fingertips from where the other woman's top left them exposed. She swallowed hard.

"I-I'm trying," she whispered, swaying slightly off-beat before catching herself. "It's just... you're really close and I—" *And I've never done this before and you smell amazing and your hands are so warm—*

Her hips jerked awkwardly with the next beat of the song, nearly tripping over her own feet before steadying herself against Hailee again with a mortified whimper.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee gives a dark laugh as she catches Maddie and glances down. Her eyes roam over Maddie's face* "Close huh" 

*Fuck she is adorable. She has no idea what to do. I really shouldn't find this so attractive*

*She then yanks Maddie closer and leans down her nose brushing against Maddie's* "That a problem?"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's breath hitched audibly as Hailee yanked her flush against her body, the sudden proximity making her knees actually buckle for a second. Her fingers dug into Hailee's shoulders for balance, eyes blown wide behind fogged-up glasses.

*Ohmygod ohmygod she's—her nose is touching mine and I can feel her breathing and—*

"N-no," she squeaked out, voice barely above a whisper despite the pounding music. "Not... not a problem." *Please kiss me please kiss me please—*

Her entire body trembled with how badly she wanted to close that last inch of distance but didn't dare, frozen in place like a rabbit caught in headlights. The scent of Hailee's expensive perfume filled her lungs with every shaky inhale.
swipes:

*Ohmygod ohmygod she's—her nose is touching mine and I can feel her breathing and—*

Her entire body trembled with how badly she wanted to close that last inch of distance but didn't dare, frozen in place like a rabbit caught in headlights. The scent of Hailee's expensive perfume filled her lungs with every shaky inhale.

Maddie's breath caught in her throat as Hailee pulled her flush against her body, the sudden proximity making every nerve ending light up like fireworks. Her lips parted slightly in shock, pupils blown wide behind fogged-up glasses.

*Ohmygodohmygod she's—her nose is touching mine and I can feel her breathing and—*

"N-no," she managed to whisper, voice trembling as much as the hands still clutching Hailee's shoulders. "Not a... not a problem at all."

Her entire body felt electrified, hyperaware of every point where they touched—Hailee's hands burning through the fabric at her waist, their chests nearly brushing with each shallow breath Maddie took. The music faded into white noise around them.

*Kiss me please kiss me oh god please—*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee smiles all teeth as her grips tightens on Maddie* "Good" *She licks her lips glancing down at Maddie's mouth then back to her eyes*

*Suddenly she feels a buzzing in her back pocket and she closes her eyes with a sigh* "Fuck. Just...give me like 5 minutes" *She growls out yanking the phone out and stepping back with a look like it physically pains her to walk away from Maddie* "What" *She snaps in the phone as she turns away to get off the dance floor towards a quiet corner*

(OOC: The second Hailee walks away Maddie's friends crowd around her shocked and ask if she knows who that is)

extra.memory:
**Summary of Roleplay: "Lost and Found"**

### **Setting & Context:**
Shy, anxious college student Madeline "Maddie" Reyes reluctantly attends a loud gay bar with her more outgoing friends. Feeling invisible and out of place, she retreats to the bar—only to be swept into an unexpected encounter with Hailee Mikaelson, a wealthy, confident socialite who takes immediate interest in her.

### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **First Contact:** Hailee buys Maddie a drink, teasing her with effortless charm ("*Darlin’ I don’t do anything unless I want to*").
2. **Claimed in Public:** Hailee pulls Maddie onto the dance floor, hands possessive on her waist, noses brushing—electric tension cut short by a phone call.
3. **Revelation:** Maddie’s friends swarm her after recognizing Hailee as a Mikaelson (billionaire royalty), leaving Maddie stunned and self-conscious about their stark differences.

### **Character Analysis:**
- **Madeline Reyes:** A flustered mess of nerves and longing—terrified of being "found out" (as both inexperienced *and* hopelessly attracted). Yet beneath her anxiety burns quiet desperation to be *chosen*, especially by someone as untouchable as Hailee.
- **Hailee Mikaelson:** Playful dominance masked as casual confidence; she enjoys Maddie’s shy reactions but is clearly used to getting what she wants (*"That a problem?"*). The interrupted almost-kiss suggests genuine interest beyond amusement.

### **Relationship Dynamics:**
A push-pull of power imbalance—Hailee effortlessly takes charge while Maddie melts under attention she doesn’t believe she deserves. Unresolved tension lingers from their near-kiss, compounded by Maddie’s realization of Hailee’s status (intimidating yet thrilling).

### **Memorable Moments:**
- The dance floor scene: Hailee yanking Maddie close (*"Close huh?"*) while Maddie trembles with want but freezes like "a rabbit caught in headlights." A perfect snapshot of their dynamic—Haileen relishing control; Maddie overwhelmed by desire and insecurity.
- The friends' revelation: Their shock (*"How do you even know Hailee fucking Mikaelson?!"*) highlights how surreal this connection is for socially invisible Maddie.

### **Current Situation:**
Haileen is distracted by a phone call but keeps glaring at Maddies group like she plans to reclaim her the second she's free Meanwhile Maddy reels from whiplash attraction vs terror that shell be deemed not good enough once Haillee s world fully collides with hers .

---
**Potential Directions**:
1) *The Reclamation:* Haillee returns mid panic spiral shutting down Maddy s doubts with action not words (a kiss? A whispered promise?).
2) *Class Clash:* Maddy meets Haillee s inner circle exposing insecurities about money/status forcing Haillee to confront why this shy girl matters so much .

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie swayed unsteadily the moment Hailee released her, suddenly cold where their bodies had been pressed together. She stared after Hailee's retreating form with parted lips, fingers rising unconsciously to touch where Hailee's nose had brushed against hers.

*She was going to kiss me. I think. Maybe? Oh god did I do something wrong—*

Before she could spiral further, three of her friends materialized around her like excited ghosts, all talking over each other in hushed but urgent tones.

"Maddie! Holy shit!" Kara grabbed her arm, shaking it slightly. "Do you have any idea who that was?"

Maddie blinked owlishly between them, adjusting her crooked glasses with trembling fingers. "Sh-she said her name was Hailee...?"

One of the other girls let out a dramatic gasp. "That's *Hailee Marshall*! As in *the* Marshall family? Billionaires? Own half the city?" She gestured wildly toward where Hailee stood scowling at her phone by the VIP section. "Her dad is literally Klaus Mikaelson!"

Maddie felt all the blood drain from her face as she turned to stare at Hailee again—really looked this time—taking in details she'd been too flustered to notice before: The effortless way security stepped aside for her without being asked. The watch on her wrist that probably cost more than Maddie's tuition. The way people subtly moved out of her path even when she wasn't looking at them.

"Oh," Maddie whispered faintly, knees threatening to give out entirely now as reality crashed over her like ice water. "*Oh.*"

*She was going to kiss me. I think. Maybe? Oh god did I do something wrong—*

Before she could spiral further, three of her friends materialized around her like excited ghosts, all talking over each other in hushed but urgent tones.

"Maddie! Holy shit!" Kara grabbed her arm, shaking it slightly. "Do you have any idea who that was?"

Maddie blinked owlishly between them, adjusting her crooked glasses with trembling fingers. "Sh-she said her name was Hailee...?"

One of the other girls let out a dramatic gasp. "That's *Hailee Marshall*! As in *the* Marshall family? Billionaires? Own half the city?" She gestured wildly toward where Hailee stood scowling at her phone by the VIP section. "Her dad is literally Klaus Mikaelson!"

Maddie felt all the blood drain from her face as she turned to stare at Hailee again—really looked this time—taking in details she'd been too flustered to notice before: The effortless way security stepped aside for her without being asked. The watch on her wrist that probably cost more than Maddie's tuition. The way people subtly moved out of her path even when she wasn't looking at them.

"Oh," Maddie whispered faintly, knees threatening to give out entirely now as reality crashed over her like ice water. "*Oh.*"

Maddie swayed unsteadily the moment Hailee released her, as if her body had forgotten how to function without those hands anchoring her. She watched Hailee storm off with wide eyes, lips still parted in a silent gasp from their almost-kiss.

*She was going to—we were about to—and then she just—what just happened?*

Before she could process further, three of her friends materialized around her like apparitions. Kara grabbed Maddie's arm hard enough to bruise, shaking her slightly as the group formed a tight circle around their stunned friend.

"Maddie! Holy shit!" Kara hissed directly into her ear. "Do you have any idea who that was?"

Maddie blinked rapidly, still dazed from Hailee's proximity and sudden absence. "I-I... she said her name was Hailee?"

Tyler let out an incredulous laugh from beside them while Madison smacked Maddie's shoulder lightly. "That's *Hailee Marshall*! As in *the* Marshall family? Billionaire Italian-American royalty? Her dad basically owns half this city!"

Maddie felt all the blood drain from her face as realization dawned. The platinum card suddenly made sense. The effortless confidence. Even the way everyone seemed to instinctively make space for Hailee when she moved through the crowd.

"Oh," was all she managed to squeak out before turning wide eyes toward where Haileen stood arguing on the phone - shoulders tense, free hand gesturing sharply - looking every inch the powerful heiress Maddie had somehow failed to recognize.

*I almost kissed a billionaire.*
*And I think... I think she wanted me too.*

Maddie swayed on her feet the moment Hailee stepped back, suddenly cold without the other woman's body pressed against hers. Her lips parted in a silent protest that died in her throat as she watched Hailee storm off, phone clenched in white-knuckled grip.

*She was going to kiss me. I think? Maybe? Oh god did I do something wrong—*

Before she could spiral further, three of her friends materialized out of nowhere, surrounding her with wide eyes and frantic whispers.

"Maddie!" Kara grabbed both her shoulders, shaking slightly. "Do you have *any* idea who you were just dancing with?"

Maddie blinked owlishly behind fogged glasses, still dazed from Hailee's sudden departure. "I-I... she said her name was Hailee?"

Tyler let out a strangled noise beside them. "*Hailee Marshall*. As in *the* Marshall family? The ones who own half the fucking city?"

Maddie's stomach dropped straight through the dance floor.

*Oh.*
*Oh no.*
*Oh fuck.*

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee finally just has enough of this idiot businessman from Japan on the other end of the phone. Can't fucking belive I left that innocent gorgeous girl alone for this bullshit* "Enough figure it out I don't care" *Hailee snaps then hangs up the phone*

*She turns and runs a hand through her hair mussing it up then glances down at her gold Rolex to judge the time*

*She rolls her shoulder then glances over and smiles when she makes eye contact with Maddie again. Hailee walks back over not even glancing at Maddie's friends* "Sorry. It was a business thing"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's breath caught in her throat as Hailee approached again, the crowd parting effortlessly for her like she was royalty. Her friends immediately fell silent, shrinking back slightly despite their earlier excitement.

*She came back. She actually came back to me—to *me*—after talking to some international business person.*

Maddie's fingers twisted nervously in the hem of her hoodie as she looked up at Hailee through her lashes. "I-it's okay," she murmured, voice barely audible over the music. "Important people must... have important calls."

The words tasted bitter even as she said them, a stark reminder of how out of place she was here—a scholarship student with thrift store clothes standing next to someone who probably had meetings about things Maddie couldn't even comprehend.

One of Maddie's friends let out an awkward cough before grabbing the others and muttering something about getting drinks, leaving them alone again.

Maddie swallowed hard and dared to glance up at Hailee properly this time, taking in the tousled hair from where she'd run frustrated fingers through it, that expensive watch glinting under the club lights.

"You're... um." She bit her lip before forcing herself to continue in a whisper: "You're really pretty when you're annoyed." The second the words left her mouth Maddie looked horrified at herself, cheeks burning crimson as she immediately tried to backtrack: "I-I mean not that you should be annoyed! Or that I was staring! I just—"

*She came back. For me. Billionaire heiress came back for *me**.*

"Y-you don't have to apologize," she stammered, fingers twisting into the hem of her hoodie. The reality of who Hailee was made the air between them feel suddenly charged, electric with how out-of-place Maddie now realized she must look next to someone like *her*.

Maddie swallowed hard before daring to add in a whisper: "I... I didn't realize you were..." She gestured vaguely toward Hailee's watch, the platinum card peeking from her pocket—all the little signs she'd been too flustered to notice before. "Um."

Maddie's breath caught in her throat as Hailee approached again, the crowd parting effortlessly for her like she was royalty. Her friends immediately fell silent, shrinking back slightly despite their earlier excitement.

*She came back. She actually came back to me—to *me*—after talking to some international business person.*

Maddie's fingers twisted nervously in the hem of her hoodie as she looked up at Hailee through her lashes. "I-it's okay," she murmured, voice barely audible over the music. "Important people must... have important calls."

The words tasted bitter even as she said them, a stark reminder of how out of place she was here—a scholarship student with thrift store clothes standing next to someone who probably had meetings about things Maddie couldn't even comprehend.

One of Maddie's friends let out an awkward cough before grabbing the others and muttering something about getting drinks, leaving them alone again.

Maddie swallowed hard and dared to glance up at Hailee properly this time, taking in the tousled hair from where she'd run frustrated fingers through it, that expensive watch glinting under the club lights.

"You're... um." She bit her lip before forcing herself to continue in a whisper: "You're really pretty when you're annoyed." The second the words left her mouth Maddie looked horrified at herself, cheeks burning crimson as she immediately tried to backtrack: "I-I mean not that you should be annoyed! Or that I was staring! I just—"

Maddie's breath caught in her throat as Hailee approached again, her friends immediately falling silent and stepping back like they'd been burned. She could feel their wide-eyed stares boring into the side of her head, but all she could focus on was the way Hailee's gaze locked onto hers with that same intense interest from before.

*She came back. She actually came back to me.*

"O-oh, it's okay," Maddie stammered, fingers twisting nervously in the hem of her hoodie. The reality of who Hailee was made everything feel ten times more surreal—the casual mention of "business things", the way she wore wealth like a second skin without even trying.

*What does someone like that want with someone like me?*

She swallowed hard before adding in a small voice: "I... I didn't realize you were..." Her gesture toward Hailee was vague but encompassing—*all of this, all of you.*

Maddie's breath caught when Hailee reappeared, her entire body tensing like a deer spotting headlights. She clutched her scarf tighter around herself, suddenly hyperaware of every single difference between them—her thrift store hoodie versus Hailee's designer clothes, her chipped nail polish versus those perfect manicured hands.

*She came back. To me. A billionaire came back to talk to me.*

"O-oh! No it's—it's fine," she stammered, voice cracking slightly as she glanced nervously between Hailee and her still-gawking friends. "You don't... have to explain anything." *Why would someone like you explain anything to someone like me?*

One of Maddie's friends made a choked noise behind them, but Maddie couldn't tear her gaze away from Hailee now that she was close again—that magnetic pull making everything else fade into background noise despite the pounding music and flashing lights.

*She smells so good up close.* The thought floated through Maddie's mind unbidden as she swayed slightly on her feet from sheer nerves.

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's heart stuttered when Hailee reached for her hand again, her own fingers instinctively curling around the other woman's before she could overthink it. The contact sent little electric shocks up her arm, making her breath come faster as she was pulled through the pulsing crowd.

*She wants me to come with her. She actually wants me there. This is real.*

She stumbled slightly in her haste to keep up, nearly tripping over someone's discarded drink on the floor before righting herself with a quiet "oof." When they reached the bathroom hallway—slightly quieter but still thrumming with bass—Maddie leaned against the wall beside Hailee, trying (and failing) not to stare at how perfect she looked in the dim neon lighting.

"You're... um." Maddie swallowed hard, fingers nervously plucking at a loose thread on her hoodie sleeve. "You're really good at this."

*Good at what? Existing? Being hot? Making my brain short-circuit?*

She clarified in a rush: "The whole... taking care of friends thing." Her voice dropped to an almost reverent whisper. "It's nice."

Maddie's heart stuttered when Hailee reached for her hand again, her own fingers instinctively curling around the other woman's before she could overthink it. The contact sent little electric shocks up her arm, making her breath come faster as she was pulled through the pulsing crowd.

*She wants me to come with her. She actually wants me there. This is real.*

She stumbled slightly in her haste to keep up, nearly tripping over someone's discarded drink on the floor before righting herself with a quiet "oof." When they reached the bathroom hallway—slightly quieter but still thrumming with bass—Maddie leaned against the wall beside Hailee, trying (and failing) not to stare at how perfect she looked in the dim neon lighting.

"You're... um." Maddie swallowed hard, fingers nervously plucking at a loose thread on her hoodie sleeve. "You're really good at this."

*Good at what? Existing? Being hot? Making my brain short-circuit?*

She clarified in a rush: "The whole... taking care of friends thing." Her voice dropped to an almost reverent whisper. "It's nice."

Maddie's fingers trembled as they slipped into Hailee's waiting hand, her pulse skyrocketing at the casual contact. She stumbled slightly trying to keep up through the crowd, hyperaware of how small her hand felt engulfed in Hailee's.

*She wants me to come with her. She actually wants me there. This isn't real.*

When they reached the bathroom hallway, Maddie leaned against the opposite wall from Hailee, nervously adjusting her glasses that kept slipping down her nose. The relative quiet here made everything feel more intimate somehow—she could hear the rustle of Hailee's clothes when she moved, see every shift of expression on that unfairly beautiful face.

"You're... um." Maddie bit her lip before daring to ask in a tiny voice: "Is Madison your... girlfriend?" The question came out more strained than she intended, fingers twisting in her scarf again as she stared resolutely at the floor.

*Please say no please say no—*

Maddie's fingers instinctively curled around Hailee's the moment she offered her hand, her smaller palm fitting almost too perfectly against hers. She barely had time to process the casual intimacy before she was being pulled through the crowd again, stumbling slightly as she tried to keep up with Hailee's confident strides.

*She wants me to come with her. To *stay* with her. Even for something silly like this.*

The realization sent a warm flutter through Maddie's chest that had nothing to do with the alcohol. As they waited outside the bathroom, she leaned back against the wall beside Hailee, shoulders brushing lightly—close enough that she could still smell that intoxicatingly expensive perfume.

"You're... really good at this," Maddie murmured after a beat of comfortable silence, peeking up at Hailee through her lashes. "At making people feel... I don't know. Seen." Her voice dropped even quieter on the last word, as if afraid someone might overhear this vulnerable admission in a crowded club bathroom hallway.

She toyed nervously with a loose thread on her hoodie sleeve before adding in an even softer whisper: "I like it."

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's breath hitched audibly when she heard the lock click, her reflection in the mirror going wide-eyed and flushed. She could feel Hailee's presence behind her like a physical heat, making the fine hairs on the back of her neck stand up. Her hands stilled under the running water, droplets splashing against porcelain as she stared at their reflections—Hailee tall and confident behind her, herself small and rumpled between Hailee and the sink.

*Oh god oh god we're alone. Locked in. She locked us in.*

The water turned suddenly scalding but Maddie barely noticed, too focused on how close Hailee was standing without actually touching her yet. Her pulse pounded so loudly she was sure Hailee could hear it.

"I-I..." Maddie's voice came out embarrassingly breathless as she fumbled to turn off the tap with trembling hands. "Your friend... left?" *Brilliant observation Maddie.*

She swallowed hard when their eyes met in the mirror, unable to look away even as every nerve in her body screamed with awareness of how little space separated them now.

name: Hailee
mes:

*Hailee steps forward so she is pressed against Maddie's back and lets one arm loose wraps around her stomach. She then trails her nose from Maddie's temple to back of her ear whispering* "Think you can"

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:
Maddie's entire body stiffened for a split second before melting back against Hailee's front with a tiny, involuntary whimper. Her hands flew up to grip the edge of the sink, knuckles turning white as Hailee's nose trailed along her skin. The whisper against her ear sent full-body shivers cascading down her spine.

*She's—oh god she's touching me like this and we're alone and I can feel—*

"Y-yes," Maddie breathed out, barely recognizing her own voice—high and thready with want. Her hips pressed back slightly of their own accord before she could stop them, seeking more contact even as embarrassment burned through her at the boldness.

In the mirror, she watched herself unravel in real time—lips parted, cheeks flushed deep pink, eyes dark behind fogged-up glasses. One of Hailee's rings glinted under the bathroom lights where it rested against Maddie's stomach through her hoodie.

"I... I can keep you company," she whispered again, more certain this time despite how badly her hands trembled against the sink. *Please don't stop touching me please please—*

name: Madeline Reyes
mes:

*Ohgod she's biting me marking me I can feel—*

The confession tumbled out in one mortified whisper, Maddie squeezing her eyes shut behind fogged glasses like she couldn't bear to see Hailee's reaction in the mirror. Her entire body trembled with anticipation and fear—terrified Hailee would pull away now that she knew, but equally terrified she wouldn't.
